page.title: 04MARKET PLACE, KINGSTON
page.content: In 1626{King Charles I}granted a Royal Charter allowing the town to hold markets. It also said no market should be held within a seven mile radius. We have two open markets,one is a permanent open market and the other is the Monday market. The permanent market sells fish and fruit and vegetables like tomatoes and potatoes. The Monday market sells clothes, fabric,toys and jewellry. They are in different places, the one that sells clothes is in the Fairfield car park and the permanent one is in the market square.
